Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 hit Youth A during an altercation.
Investigation Incident 1
The Complainant was interviewed on 03/12/2024 over the phone.
He stated he had been told by Youth A that there was a past
incident where Supervisor 1 had punched him in the face. The
complainant was not sure why there was a distinct inconsistency
between what he was told by Youth A and what Youth A offered in
the interview for this investigation. The complainant stated he had
several interactions with Youth A from the time this incident
occurred on 11/07/2023 to when Youth A stated this to him on
02/26/2024, and Youth A never said anything about it prior.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone on 02/27/2024 along
with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A recalled the incident in question
where he had a physical altercation with another youth and was
separated by Supervisor 1. Youth A stated he picked the fight
with Youth B and Supervisor 1 physically separated them. Youth
A believed Youth B then left the room. Youth A also recalled he
and Supervisor 1 were then alone in the common area of the unit
with everyone else outside at this point. Youth A stated he then
argued with Supervisor 1 and hit him. Youth A recalled
Supervisor 1 took a step back from him. Youth A stated
Supervisor 1 never hit him back and there was no physical
interaction between him and Supervisor 1 after this point in time.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
02/27/2024 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the
2

facility. He recalled the incident in question. He stated he was
alone in the unit when Youth A ran up to Youth B and attacked
him. Supervisor 1 recalled engaging physically with them. This
was brief and his only contact was attempting to pull the two youth
away from each other. He recalled this was successful and did
not believe Youth A and Youth B fought any more after this point.
Supervisor 1 recalled telling Youth A that “You can’t do this no
more; you beat him for no reason.” Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A
then got upset at him and proceeded to punch him in the face.
Supervisor 1 stated he did not punch back and did not know how
to react at the moment. He stated Youth A then backed away
from him and was able to be verbally de-escalated. Supervisor 1
recalled leaving the unit and missing work for the next few days
because he was injured as a result. Supervisor 1 denied ever
hitting Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 03/11/2024. He
recalled the incident in question where Youth A attacked him in
the unit. Youth B stated he tried to fight Youth A back once this
started but recalled a staff member pulling them apart. He could
not recall who this was. Youth B stated he never saw a staff
member hit Youth A during this incident, but he also left the
common area soon after he was separated from Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed over the phone on 03/12/2024. He
stated he saw the incident in question between Youth A and
Supervisor 1 through the window while he was outside. Youth C
recalled Youth A punched Supervisor 1 several times and that
Supervisor 1 did not punch back. Youth C believed Supervisor 1
wanted to fight back but could not offer specifics as to why it
appeared that way. Youth C recalled Youth A walked away from
Supervisor 1 and that was all he witnessed from this interaction.
During a video conference held on 03/22/2024 DHHS Worker 1
stated they would not have findings.
Documents reviewed:
• Two clips of video footage dated 11/07/2023 were provided
by the facility:
o The first video clip began at approximately
12:00pm. Youth A could be seen approaching
Youth B from behind while Youth B was seated in
the common area of the unit. Youth A proceeded to
punch Youth A several times and a fight
escalated. Supervisor 1 was nearby and attempted
to physically separate the two-fighting youth. He
3

was able to do so approximately 30 seconds
later. Youth B then moved down the hallway of the
unit with another unnamed youth. Youth A and
Supervisor 1 then interacted with Youth A getting up
into the chest of Supervisor 1 while they were
standing. Youth A attempted to shove Supervisor 1
backward and Supervisor 1’s hands came up to
Youth A briefly in response. Supervisor 1 then
stepped backward from Youth A and took off his
jacket in an aggressive manner. The video clip then
cut out at that time.
o The second clip did not have any time stamps but
appeared to come from the immediate time period
after the fight between Youth A and Youth B had
been broken up. In this footage Youth A could be
seen standing in front of Supervisor 1 and appearing
to be verbally escalated. Youth A stepped toward
Supervisor 1 and punched him with his right hand to
the right side of Supervisor 1’s jaw. Supervisor 1
stumbled backward a step but never lost his
footing. The video footage cut out at that point.
o The facility confirmed no other video footage of the
incident existed because of the time period that had
elapsed since it occurred.
• An incident report dated 11/07/2023 was provided by the
facility. This was authored by Staff 2 and it described a
similar course of events as was provided by Supervisor 1
during his interview in that Youth A assaulted Supervisor 1
after Supervisor 1 intervened in a fight between Youth A
and Youth B.
• A report from law enforcement dated 11/07/2023 was
provided and reviewed. Law enforcement was called to
campus after the incident in question and after Youth A left
the unit and walked around campus. In this report
Supervisor 1 had a similar statement to his interview for this
investigation, where he stated he was punched by Youth A
and he did not punch back. Youth A reported to law
enforcement at the time that Supervisor 1 did punch him,
and he punched Supervisor 1 back in response.
• No records of discipline were noted for Supervisor 1.
Incident 2
Youth A was interviewed over the phone on 02/27/2024 along
with DHHS Worker 1. During the interview covering the
allegations of Incident 1, Youth A stated he had been hit with a
4

vacuum by a staff member yesterday. Youth A stated he had
been in the hallway of the unit and was verbally escalating. He
recalled arguing with Staff 1. Youth A stated Staff 1 then threw a
vacuum at him, and it hit him on the side. Youth A could not recall
much of what was said between the two of them but recalled Staff
1 stating “I’m not coming back” and then walking out of the unit.
Youth A believed one other youth may have witnessed this but
that no other staff would have.
The Complainant was interviewed on 03/12/2024 over the phone.
He stated the facility made him aware timely of the incident
involving Youth A and Staff 1 and did not have any additional
information to provide.
Attempts to make contact with Staff 1 were made through the
course of the investigation and return phone contact was
unsuccessful.
During a video conference held on 03/22/2024 DHHS Worker 1
stated they would have findings.
Documents reviewed:
• Video footage dated 02/26/2024 was provided by the
facility. In this footage it was clearly shown that Staff 1
swung a vacuum at Youth A and hit him in his left side
while they were inside the unit. Youth A appeared to be
arguing with Staff 1 while she was out of the view of the
video footage. At 6:39:30 pm Staff 1 can be seen at the
bottom of the footage approaching Youth A. Youth A did
not move. Staff 1 swung the vacuum and hit Youth A at
6:39:32 pm. Staff 1 was not seen after that point in the
video footage. The footage did not include any audio.
There was no one else around this incident other than Staff
2, who was at the end of the hallway when this occurred.
• An incident report dated 02/28/2024 was provided. This
was authored by Staff 2. In this incident report a consistent
record of events was provided as was seen in the video
footage. Staff 2 documented Youth A had yelled
obscenities at Staff 1, followed by Staff 1 hitting Youth A
with the vacuum. Staff 2 documented Staff 1 then left the
unit.
• No records of discipline were noted for Staff 1 prior to this
incident. It was confirmed with the facility that Staff 1 was
placed on administrative leave on 02/27/2024 and her
employment was then terminated on 03/01/2024.
5

Analysis Through interviews with youth and documentation reviewed there
was evidence found that Staff 1 hit Youth A during an escalated
incident on 02/26/2024. There was no evidence found that
Supervisor 1 hit Youth A during an escalated incident on
11/07/2023.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR # 2023C0000726SI dated 10/09/23, CAP approved 10/12/23
SIR # 2024C0001086SI dated 03/05/24, CAP approved 03/27/24
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
